intro: Gilia leucocephala, commonly known as the white-headed gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a prominent yellow center. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Gilia leucocephala is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
